title: [Large-scale] Computer Scaffolding Design for Project-Based Programming Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational programming concepts and work experience in social domains
context.additional_context: Environment enabling real-time collaboration and scaffolding tool utilization for learners assuming administrator/leader roles, with digital devices provided

learning_goals: Learners can design programming solutions to solve real-world problems in social domains by utilizing computer scaffolding during project-based learning.
Learners can enhance their abilities in problem understanding (20.91%), module design (21.86%), and process design (25.70%) through scaffolding based on the 4C/ID model.
Learners can improve their performance in product quality (35.49%) and subject knowledge (38.98%) compared to pre-assessment in final project evaluations.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
